Targets

 

DND targets for use with the cadet air rifle include:

 

•paper grouping targets and scoring (application) targets,

 

•Biathlon Canada approved reactive targets (e.g. falling plate targets),

 

•targets  for approved optional competitions such as ones conducted by the Dominion of Canada Rifle Association (DCRA) and the Shooting Federation of Canada (SFC) or their affiliates; and/or

 

•light reactive targets such as falling plates, spinners or similar devices when approved.

 

Mounting paper targets

 

Paper targets are mounted on a soft penetrable board, such as cardboard or corrugated plastic, usually using small plastic-headed thumb tacks or tape.

Targets

Marksmanship scoring (application) target

Marksmanship grouping target

Biathlon reactive target (falling plate target) for air rifles.

Paper targets are mounted on a soft penetrable board, such as cardboard or corrugated plastic, usually using tape or small plastic headed thumb tacks. Targets should be placed at the same level as the individual’s shoulder or head. If a target falls or malfunctions it is not necessary to call a ceasefire; targets may be reattached or fixed following the relay.
